DoingBusinessAsName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PENNSYLVANIA SOCIETY OF TAX & ACCOUNTING PROFESSIONALS

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE PSTAP PROMOTES AND MAINTAINS HIGH PROFESSIONAL AND ETHICAL STANDARDS OF ACCOUNTANTS IN PUBLIC PRACTICE IN PENNSYLVANIA; DEVELOPS AND IMPROVES ACCOUNTANCY EDUCATION; AND PROTECTS THE INTERESTS OF THE PUBLIC AND MEMBERS OF THE PSTAP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PSTAP PROMOTES AND MAINTAINS HIGH PROFESSIONAL AND ETHICAL STANDARDS OF ACCOUNTANTS IN PUBLIC PRACTICE IN PENNSYLVANIA; DEVELOPS AND IMPROVES ACCOUNTANCY EDUCATION; AND PROTECTS THE INTERESTS OF THE PUBLIC AND MEMBERS OF THE PSTAP.
IRS990.Desc: STATE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM: ANNUALLY, THE SOCIETY AWARDS TWO SCHOLARSHIPS TO PENNSYLVANIA RESIDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE MEMBERSHIP MAKES VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTIONS WITH THE PAYMENT OF THEIR DUES TO SUPPORT THIS PROGRAM. THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO ATTRACT THE BEST AND THE BRIGHTEST PENNSYLVANIA STUDENTS INTO THE ACCOUNTING PROFESSION, TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS FROM DIVERSE FIELDS TO PURSUE AN ADVANCED EDUCATION IN ACCOUNTANCY, AND TO INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED BY AN ACCOUNTING CAREER PATH.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PAST PRESIDENT SCHOLARSHIP AWARD: ANNUALLY, THE SOCIETY AWARDS A SCHOLARSHIP TO A PENNSYLVANIA RESIDENT WHO DEMONSTRATES ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE BUXMONT CHAPTER TO RECOGNIZE THE PAST ACHIEVEMENTS OF ONE OF ITS MEMBERS WHO IS DECEASED, ROBERT T. ZALESKI. THERE IS NO DEDICATED FUNDING STREAM; THEREFORE, THIS PROGRAM IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY TO DETERMINE IF THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM SHOULD BE AWARDED IN ANY GIVEN YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATION PROGRAMS: THE SOCIETY PROVIDES CONTINUING EDUCATION SEMINARS FOR ITS MEMBERSHIP THROUGH WEBINARS AND SEMINARS AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA. MEMBERS INCREASE THEIR PROFESSIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND COMPETENCY IN THE MIDST OF RAPID REGULATORY CHANGES, EXPERIENCE REWARDING INTERACTION WITH FELLOW PROFESSIONALS IN A COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT, AND DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS TO ENHANCE JOB PERFORMANCE AND CAREER PROSPECTS.

BooksInCareOfDetail.PersonNm: PA SOCIETY OF TAX AND ACCOUNTING PR

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.PersonNm: FRANCIS J CELLINI EA ABA ATA ATP
ARLAN R CHRIST EA ATA ATP
MARVIN R HUTTMAN CPA CFP MST EA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FUNDS FOR POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE RAISED AND MAINTAINED SEPARATELY FROM THE SOCIETY FUNDS. POLITICAL FUNDS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE PENNSYLVANIA ACCOUNTANT POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE, A SEPARATE ORGANIZATION THAT REPRESENTS THE INTERESTS OF TAX AND ACCOUNTING PROFESSIONALS IN THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA BEFORE PENNSYLVANIA'S GENERAL ASSEMBLY AND OTHER ELECTED OFFICIALS AND WHOSE EXPENDITURES ARE MADE TO SUPPORT CANDIDATES WHO FURTHER THE INTERESTS OF THE ACCOUNTING PROFESSION. THE PA ACCOUNTANT PAC WILL NOT ENDORSE CANDIDATES BUT DOES CONTRIBUTE TO INDIVIDUAL CAMPAIGNS AND PURCHASE OF TICKETS TO POLITICAL FUNDRAISERS.

Pt III-B Line 2A: THE PENNSYLVANIA SOCIETY OF TAX & ACCOUNTING PROFESSIONALS ONLY MAKES EXEMPT SECTION 162(e)(2) DIRECT LOBBYING EXPENDITURES TO LOCAL COUNCIL OR SIMILAR GOVERNING BODY WITH RESPECT TO LOCAL LEGISLATION OF DIRECT INTEREST TO THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS MEMBERS.

THE SOCIETY ACTS AS THE COORDINATOR AND REGISTRAR OF CERTAIN WORKING TOGETHER SEMINAR PRESENTATIONS ON BEHALF OF SEVERAL STAKEHOLDERS. REGISTRATION FEES ARE COLLECTED FOR THESE PROGRAMS AND SUBSEQUENTLY REMITTED. AS THE COORDINATOR FOR THE VARIOUS STAKEHOLDERS, THE SOCIETY ACTS AS A CUSTODIAN OVER FUNDS ADVANCED FOR THE SEMINAR.

THESE CUSTODIAL FUNDS, AND CORRESPONDING FIDUCIARY LIABILITY, ARE REFLECTED ON FORM 990, PART X. THE REGISTRATION FEES COLLECTED FOR THIS PROGRAM AND SUBSQUENT REMITTANCE OF THESE FUNDS ARE NOT INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART VIII AND PART IX.

THE SOCIETY REVIEWS INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN INCOME TAX RETURNS TO DETERMINE IF THERE ARE ANY INCOME TAX UNCERTAINTIES. THIS INCLUDES POSITIONS THAT THE ENTITY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES OR NOT SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE SOCIETY RECOGNIZES TAX BENEFITS FROM UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SOCIETY DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS OR ASSOCIATED UNRECOGNIZED BENEFITS. INCOME TAX RETURNS OF THE SOCIETY ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAX AUTHORITIES, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: STATE SCHOLARSHIP FOR PA ACCOUNTING STUDENTS
PAST PRESIDENT SCHOLARSHIP FOR PA ACCOUNTING STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PSTAP PUBLICIZES ITS SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM THROUGH ITS WEBSITE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE ONLY TO THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE ENROLLED FULL-TIME AT A PENNSYLVANIA COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY HAVING COMPLETED 60 CREDIT HOURS, DECLARED ACCOUNTING MAJOR, AND MAINTAINED A MINIMUM GPA OF 3.0. AN APPLICANT IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN APPLICATION WHICH IS REVIEWED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE CHOOSES WINNERS BASED ON THE CONTENT OF THE APPLICATIONS SUBMITED AND AWARDS TWO STATE SCHOLARSHIPS AND ONE PAST PRESIDENT SCHOLARSHIP.

NO PAYMENTS EXCEEDED THE REPORTING THRESHOLDS DURING THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX YEAR. THIS VENDOR TRANSACTION SOLELY INVOLVING TAX PREPARATION SERVICES IS BEING DISCLOSED VOLUNTARILY DUE TO AN EMPLOYEE AND AN EMPLOYER RELATIONSHIP.

OFFICER AND DIRECTOR RELATIONSHIPS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: MARVIN HUTTMAN AND JOYCE HUTTMAN HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP; NEIL TRAMA AND JEANETTE TRAMA HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP; FRANCIS WORDEN AND JEANETTE TRAMA HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSIP; THOMAS OSTROWSKI AND BERNARD DEVERSON HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

THE ORGANIZATION IS COMPRISED OF NINE CHAPTERS THAT HAVE MEMBERS. EACH CHAPTER IS REPRESENTED ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS ONE VOTING RIGHT. THE MEMBERSHIP OF THE SOCIETY CONSISTS OF ACTIVE, ASSOCIATE, STUDENT, LIFE, RETIRED, AND HONORARY MEMBER CLASSIFICATIONS.

MEMBERS CLASSIFIED AS ACTIVE OR LIFE MEMBERS ARE ENTITLED TO ONE VOTE IN THE ELECTION OF THE ORGANIZATIONS OFFICERS (EXCLUDING THE PRESIDENT) AND MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY. THE ELECTIONS ARE HELD AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE ORGANIZATION. A NOMINATIONS COMMITTEE OF MEMBERS PROPOSE CANDIDATES TO BE VOTED ON AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. IN ADDITION, AN ACTIVE OR LIFE MEMBER HAS THE RIGHT TO PROPOSE OTHER NOMINEES FOR POSITIONS ON THE ORGANIZATIONS GOVERNING BODY IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE NAMES SELECTED BY THE NOMINATING COMMITTEE HAVE BEEN SUBMITTED TO THE MEETING.

ACTIVE AND LIFE MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION HAVE THE RIGHT TO VOTE ON ANY PROPOSED CHANGES TO THE ORGANIZATIONS BY-LAWS OR CORPORATE CHARTER. AN AMENDMENT OF THE BY-LAWS OR CORPORATE CHARTER IS APPROVED IF A MAJORITY VOTE REPRESENTING AT LEAST TWO-THIRDS (2/3) OF THE MEMBERS PRESENT OR REFERENDUM APPROVES THE AMENDMENT. NOTICE OF THE INTENTION TO OFFER AMENDMENTS SHALL BE COMMUNICATED TO MEMBERS AT LEAST 30 DAYS PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL MEETING.

THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD THROUGH AN E-MAIL AND RESPONSE IN ADVANCE OF THE FILING OF THE 990 AND A PRESENTATION TO THE BOARD BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. THE PROCESS INCLUDES PROVIDING THEM WITH A COPY, PRESENTING INFORMATION REGARDING CERTAIN SECTIONS OF THE 990, AND ANSWERING ANY QUESTIONS FROM THE BOARD.

ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, ALL BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS, AND THOSE EMPLOYEES ANNUALLY DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD SHALL BE PROVIDED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND BE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN THE ACKNOWLEDGMENT AND DISCLOSURE FORM. ALL COMPLETED FORMS SHALL BE PROVIDED TO AND REVIEWED BY THE PSTAP EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AS WELL AS ALL OTHER CONFLICT INFORMATION PROVIDED BY BOARD MEMBERS.

COMPENSATION PAID TO THE SOCIETY'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS APPROVED BY THE SOCIETY'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER RECEIVING THE RECOMMENDATION FROM THE SOCIETY'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WHO ENGAGE IN A DETAILED REVIEW OF THESE INDIVIDUALS.

COMPENSATION PAID TO THE SOCIETY'S TREASURER, SECRETARY, AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IS APPROVED BY THE SOCIETY'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER RECEIVING THE RECOMMENDATION FROM THE SOCIETY'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WHO ENGAGE IN A DETAILED REVIEW OF THESE INDIVIDUALS.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE SOCIETY'S WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST.

THE SOCIETY HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE AND HAS NOT CHANGED EITHER ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS FOR ASSUMING RESPONSIBILITY OF OVERSEEING THE LEVEL OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT SERVICE AND DESIGNATION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT DURING THE TAX YEAR.

THE PRESENTATION RESTATES THE PSTAP'S ASSETS FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022 BY RECORDING AN INCREASE OF $34,991. A CORRESPONDING INCREASE IN FUNDS HELD AS CUSTODIAN FOR THIS YEAR HAS ALSO BEEN RECOGNIZED.
